question.title: Set input type of a rest web service to Json

node.contents: I'm having a rest web service and i'm executing it through Rest Client in FF. Till now it was used as a post method now i've to change it's input type to JSON i.e now i'm sending json input to that ws but on rest client i'm getting

node.contents: I think this code can help you:

astNode.text: I think this code can help you:

elements.contents: @POST @Path("/your_path") @Consumes(MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON) @Produces(MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON) //Receive and send a json object public JSONObject receiveJSONObject(JSONObject json) throws JSONException { return json; }

comments.text: //Receive and send a json object public JSONObject receiveJSONObject(JSONObject json) throws JSONException { return json; }

units.rawText: @POST @Path("/your_path") @Consumes(MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON) @Produces(MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON) //Receive and send a json object public JSONObject receiveJSONObject(JSONObject json) throws JSONException { return json; }

elements.contents: private void sendJSONObject() throws JSONException{ ClientConfig config = new DefaultClientConfig(); Client client = Client.create(config); client.addFilter(new LoggingFilter()); WebResource service = client.resource("*your_adress_and_path*"); JSONObject data= new JSONObject(); dados.put("Name", "John"); dados.put("Age", "30"); dados.put("City", "Tokyo"); ClientResponse client_response = service.accept(MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON).post(ClientResponse.class, data); System.out.println("Status: "+client_response.getStatus()); client.destroy(); }

units.rawText: private void sendJSONObject() throws JSONException{ ClientConfig config = new DefaultClientConfig(); Client client = Client.create(config); client.addFilter(new LoggingFilter()); WebResource service = client.resource("*your_adress_and_path*"); JSONObject data= new JSONObject(); dados.put("Name", "John"); dados.put("Age", "30"); dados.put("City", "Tokyo"); ClientResponse client_response = service.accept(MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON).post(ClientResponse.class, data); System.out.println("Status: "+client_response.getStatus()); client.destroy(); }

node.contents: I'm not sure, but I think you aren't setting the content type as json. This code worked for me.
